Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are 11 nSPV fullnodes for ILN, theoretical capacity of almost 10,000 clients, assuming just one fullnode peer per nSPV client. the 873 limit is pretty hardcoded, wont be easy to update. just need more fullnodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess spreading out the load with 873 nSPV clients for each fullnode, that shouldnt cause it that much load as most of the time the superlite clients will just be idle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes it is a hardcoded limit on unix as the select call only handles up to 1024 and there are some slots reserved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @allbits getnewaddress just generates a random new address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: doesnt store it anyway, doesnt login, though maybe i should make it automatically login

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the getinfo shows the most recent login info

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my idea is that unless you specifically login, there is no indication you are actually using a privkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so getinfo just ignores anything getnewaddress does, that is just to generate a new address now, nothing to do with login

Content: maybe add `nspv_logout` call which will immideatly flush wif from memory? (this way apps will be able to control for how long keep wif)
